sentence.text: This includes the first two genes linked to recessively inherited isolated dystonia, that is, positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration (hippocalcin) and growth plate cartilage chondrocyte morphogenesis (collagen VI alpha 3).

entity.text: positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration

sentence.text: The novel myoclonus-dystonia genes endoplasmic reticulum calcium ion homeostasis and modulation of chemical synaptic transmission also implicate abnormal calcium signaling in dystonia.
The newly reported myoclonus-dystonia gene, cell morphogenesis involved in differentiation, plays also a role in the formation of brain structures.

Defects in neurodevelopment likewise seem to be a recurrent scheme underpinning mainly complex dystonias, for example those attributable to biallelic mutations in tetrahydrobiopterin biosynthetic process, TH, positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration, or to heterozygous negative regulation of microtubule polymerization mutations.

entity.text: positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration
